page.title: 06HOUSES
page.content: There are{412}houses in Kirklevington village and{56}in Picton two thirds of these people are no more than twenty years old. Before{1965}the village consisted of farm houses and cottages. Some of these are built from local handmade bricks from Picton brickworks. The modern houses are privately owned and have electricty, water and sewage. There is no gas in the villages so oil is mainly used for central heating.The dwelling maybe called detached and semi-detached, bungalow or dormer. they contain a lounge, study, kitchen, utility room, bathroom,{2, 3, 4, 5}bedrooms and one or two garages. Present day prices for a two bedroom cottage would be{Â£35,000 detached house{Â£60,000.}Rates are paid to central council funds for essential services such as refuse disposal, road maintenance, education etc.
